intro: Humboltia centranthera, commonly known as the coastal morning glory, is a flowering plant native to coastal regions of California and Baja California. It is characterized by its striking blue to violet trumpet-shaped flowers that bloom in the early morning. The plant has heart-shaped leaves and thrives in sandy, well-drained soils along the coastline. It is a member of the Convolvulaceae family, which includes other morning glory species. Humboltia centranthera is often found growing in open, sunny habitats near the shore.
